title: Bug 5340 - Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
OB: When adding an exception breakpoint, cancelling the operation in the progress dialog has no effect.
EB: The progress dialog should close immediately and the exception list should not be displayed. If cancellation is requested, the operation should either be halted or the cancel button should be disabled. To achieve this, when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run, pass false for the cancelable parameter.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective.
2) Click the J! button to add an exception breakpoint.
3) In the progress dialog, click cancel.
